title: 107_s1210
content: SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE. The Act is titled the "Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002." It includes amendments to extend block grants and federal guarantees under the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 until 2007. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to extend provisions until 2007, including training, technical assistance, and loan guarantee fund adjustments for fiscal years 1997 through 2007. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include a definition for "housing related community development," which encompasses facilities, businesses, activities, or infrastructure that aid in the construction of reservation housing and reduce construction costs. This definition excludes activities under the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act. SEC. 4 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include comprehensive housing and community development planning activities. SEC. 5 addresses the treatment of program income and labor standards. Section 104 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include provisions regarding the utilization of income for housing related activities. This amendment also addresses restricted access or reduction of income for specific purposes. The amendment to Section 104 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 includes provisions on the utilization of income for housing-related activities, addressing restricted access or reduction of income for specific purposes. SEC. 6. REGULATIONS. SEC. 7 amends Section 601 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 to include housing related community development activities. SEC. 8 focuses on feasibility studies to enhance housing assistance in Native communities. SEC. 8 amends Section 202 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 to conduct a feasibility study for a community development demonstration project in Native communities. The Secretary will conduct a study on the feasibility of establishing a demonstration project for Indian tribes to use funds from the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002 for community development projects. The study will be submitted to Congress within one year of the Act's enactment. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must complete a study on black mold infestation in Native American housing within 180 days of this Act and submit recommendations to Congress.
